author: jorgejaqa
title: Clean Water helping, carbon neutral
description: Clean water is hard to get, we propose a way to help and educate about Cardano and cryptocurrencies, replicable around the world.

f6_assessments.q0:
The intelligent interweaving of two problems, namely large scale Cardano adoption / exposure and access to clean drinking water in post colonised countries ("developing" or "emergent" countries). 
If done mindfully this proposal could have quite a large impact on the life of a couple of thousand people and the Cardano ecosystem in general, as more minds would be exposed to the Cardano mission, some of which potentially engage in very meaningful ways in the future. 
The Misc challenge fits well, as the charitable nature of the project wouldn't be suitable for the "business solutions" challenge; in general F8 is missing a SDG focused challenge!


To make space for the devils advocate here. For me the solution was not articulated well enough. Is the video being shown before the water is pumping? Or starting couple seconds before? The content is also not further specified, that would be helpful to assess the impact in more detail. How often will the video be updated or is it a youtube playlist? How many villages (people) will have the station in walking distance?


From my layman perspective it seems the water pumping video box could scale up in many ways (gamify with questionnaire and raffle, create foundation) or how it will tie into the stake pool operation of the proposer in detail. On the pool website it is mentioned that the cleaning stations can only be maintained if enough delegations are pouring in, however how much is enough is not defined. Other scaling options are not properly described directly by the proposer. Might have been because it seemed straightforward to her/him, since the project would prove it can be done in a very rural area. Then the only  scaling factors would be local solar panel, workforce and material prices.
f6_assessments.q1:
All relevant skills seem to be available as the budget breakdown clearly shows that this is not the first time designing (and building a water cleaning station). Its well broken down, seems reasonable (parts are budgeted at about 30-50% less than in Western -Europe).  However I'm missing the video installation items on the list and working hours could be further specified,on a positive note,  it seems they have a local contractor (Tinson) at hand. The company (Tinson) is mentioned on the pool's website as well, but no further information or impressions of the demo cleaning station are available at first glance.

A nice to have would be details on how the station become  sustainable once the active carbon has been depleted? They describe very well in the risk paragraph of the impact section that maintenance costs will increase and will be funded with delegations from the stakepool or in case they won't suffice will offer ad space to local businesses.  Listing what is included in the maintenance would be a big help for the assessment.

The 3 month time frame seems reasonable on account of worldwide supply chain frictions, however the maintenance plan is not mentioned.
f6_assessments.q2:
How is success  and progress measured?
The 3 month timeframe seems reasonable, tho the progress granularity is quite coarse. The only metric points are the receiving of funds, ordering of equipment and finished installations. it is not mentioned where this tracking is taking place, tho my guess would be the social channels of the AGUA pool.

Since clean water offers many direct and indirect health benefits its difficult to measure those, but some way should be articulated (a quick survey at the local towns doctors or shaman?) 

However the overall auditability is very difficult, since this is not a software project and gaming this with current video editing technology and swarm labour is not too difficult. 
It would all come down to the trust in the AGUA stakepool.

f6_assessments.q0: This proposal might be more appropriate in nation building or scaling-up community hubs challenges, but OK it's in Miscellaneous because there's no clear match.  In any case, the impact of Cardano education by distributing clean water in small rural areas of Yucatan peninsula will probably not have a big impact on Cardano.  I support the initiative itself, but as it relates to expanding the Cardano ecosystem I see no clear match or benefit.
f6_assessments.q1: The author's breakdown for the project as well as the statement that they have partnered with a business entity (Tinson) to execute this project, indicates they may have a real intention and capability to implement the project.  However, the project proposed also contains an education element revolving around Cardano.  And this budget sort of exposes that there is no financial or scheduling plan to actually implement that education initiative.  So while I could not strongly disagree with likelihood of implementation success, I am challenging implementation of the whole plan with a disagreement position due budgeting contradictions with the solutions statement, exposing that the link to Cardano may have been fabricated only for the purpose of accessing funds in this challenge.
f6_assessments.q2: My experience working on a project basis in conflict zones and impoverished communities has given me the experience to clearly state that there will be limited to no ability to audit delivery of clean water to rural areas in Mexico.  Adding in an educational element for a technology that is likely out of reach for this target audience at the current time, and I would confidently reduce my auditability rating to zero.   That being said, I hope the proposer does find an alternative way to deliver this meaningful support, as I believe every human deserves access to clean water and hygiene.  I just don't think this is the appropriate forum.

f6_assessments.q0:
The intention behind this proposal is great, it helps people in need to gain access to something that most westerners take for granted. It is a bit unfortunate that the problem statement is written in a weird way, this poses the risk of voters neglecting the proposal too fast. A suggestion is to write it more cohesive and make a clearer connection of how you provide water to people and educate them about Cardano.
The proposal aligns with the Miscellaneous Challenge setting since there is no other "perfect fit category" to submit this  proposal in. 
The water systems will be installed in several locations in Mexico and broadcast educational content about Cardano & cryptocurrencies. However, this proposal seeks funding for the watering systems but does not mention anything about the video material that is to be displayed. It would be favorable for the proposal to include information about the video material. Question such as these could be addressed: 
Is the video material produced already? How do you assure that the information in the videos are correct? How do you make the videos interesting and not cheesy, furthering bad rumors about cryptocurrencies? If you don’t have the videos already, what is you plan to produce these? Do you have a separate budget for the video production?
There is a challenge setting currently going on in Fund 8 named "F8: Film + Media (FAM) creatives unite!", you might be able to collaborate with teams from there to produce the video material. 
All in all, the proposal aligns with the challenge setting and it is impactful in multiple aspects. It is however hard to assess and take a further stand with the questions stated above, therefore the score will be neutral in terms of impact. Score given: 3 stars.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposers have laid out a detailed budget and some reasoning behind it, the feasibility section is written like a fact-filled technical specification more than anything. The team claims to have several years of relevant experience in the water industry, it would be helpful if these claims could be verified further. Furthermore, a timeline for delivering the solution should be further expanded on more than just a set 3 month deadline. These points would increase the credibility of the proposal, and as a result also increasing the feasibility score. For now, this proposal receives 3 points in terms of feasibility.
f6_assessments.q2:
The first question in the auditability section asks *how* you will measure the progress of the project. This proposal is stating that the deadline is 3 months to implement the project instead of addressing this question. 
Furthermore, the definition of success is defined as 3 systems installed and "people and families using it, improving the health and economy of all the people in the town.". This is a rather vague description and you should include some metrics that relevant, easy to measure and follow up. An example could be to broadcast the educational video X amount of times. Or maybe provide X amounts of water over Y amount of time. 
The proposal is hard to audit in its current state and will receive a score of 1 stars in terms of auditability.

f6_assessments.q0: The prosers provided a clear and concise description of an issue in their problem statement. The proposal idea could generate positive impact to the community if the advertisement get the interest intended to provide. With more installments, the proposal have the ability to scale and apply to other fund challenges for example “Grow North America, Grow Cardano“ (even though this is a continuation of a fund 7 challenge).
f6_assessments.q1:
The proposal could expand more about the group of team members or the leader that leads the group. The skills/experience in the team of accomplishments could also provide a solid foundation of expertise in the team.
The budget is outlined clearly and broken down into identifiable items that is necessary to accomplish the work. 
A plan has been shown about what is to be done in different areas but not a explicit plan has been laid out about the time estimation of the actual work time in each area.
f6_assessments.q2: The proposal has a time horizon for achievement but can be clearer in its roadmap with millstones. The proposer could in some way show for the community its progress and success of how their work has been going.

f6_assessments.q0: The proposer state two purposes for the proposal. One is giving clean water to the people help to increase the health in some rural areas in the Mexico Yucatan Peninsula. The second is creating the awareness of the Cardano by educating through advertisement in these locations. In this proposal, only focus on solving the first purpose and do not mention in detail the educational plan to increase awareness about the Cardano ecosystem. Therefore, I can't comment whether the proposal address the challenge or not.
f6_assessments.q1: The proposal does not have roadmap with timeline and detail plan to implement the solution. Proposal also lack detail plan about educating the Cardano ecosystem. On the other hand, I see the project implement in a rural area that may not have reach to basic infrastructure including basic education, so it is not feasible to educating about the Cardano ecosystem. However, in terms of clean water supply, I believe with the proposer's experience, a clean water providing plan can be feasible.
f6_assessments.q2: The proposer does not give metric to evaluate the effectiveness of clean water systems after being put into operation, nor metric about the Cardano community educational outcomes. So there is not enough information to audit and track progress.

solution: Clean water, increasing the health and creating the awareness of the Cardano project by educating through advertisement in these locations
experience: The company has several years in the water and wastewater treatment industry, we have installed several of solar panels for home and business and we have already started with this project delivering in this date more than 26,000 liters with little funding and the pool AGUA.
